text:

This is the shocking moment football fans were caught on camera singing sick songs about Celtic legend Tommy Burns. 
The former Scotland international sadly died in 2008 after suffering from skin cancer - and has now been targeted by sick trolls. 
In the video, fans on a coach can be heard singing "You'll never see Tommy Burns again" and describing him as a "f***ing skeleton". 
They can also be seen singing loyalist song Father’s Advice and added the chant of "f*** Tommy Burns, he’s dead" into the middle of it. Fans singing the vile chants (Photo: Daily Record) 
Burns was a close friend of Walter Smith and Ally McCoist and worked alongside the duo in the Scotland national set up with the former Rangers managers carrying Tommy’s coffin during his funeral service. Tommy Burns during a training session at Celtic's training ground (Photo: PA) 
Burns played 352 league games for Celtic between 1975 and 1989 before joining Kilmarnock where he spent the next five years. 
He won eight caps for Scotland later managed Kilmarnock, Celtic and Reading. Like us on Facebook
